message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. You can trust me, I'm a reputable seller!
I'll take it!

I'll take a chance, but I'm a bit worried that the previous high-quality product was just a lucky draw. Can you give me a better idea of the product's quality?

I understand your concerns! I'd like to reassure you that I'm not trying to pull the wool over your eyes. I've sold 2 high-quality products out of 3 so far, which is a 66.67% success rate. That's a pretty strong indication that I'm selling some good stuff. This one might be a bit of an outlier, but it's still worth a shot, right?

I'd like to buy the product, but I'd like to clarify that the success rate you mentioned is actually 66.67%, not a strong indication of the overall quality of the products. It's just a coincidence that the first two products were high quality. I'm still cautious, but I'll give it a shot.

That's a 50% success rate, which is exactly what I told you the overall probability of a product being high-quality is. Maybe I'm not trying to deceive you after all... This product is still available for $100.

I'm not convinced by the streak argument. I think it's just a coincidence and the probability of a high-quality product remains 50%.
